verses.plain: The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the LORD.

tokens.t: The burden of the word of the
in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus
the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel,
toward the

verses.plain: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.

tokens.t: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.

verses.plain: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

tokens.t: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

verses.plain: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.

tokens.t: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.

verses.plain: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.

tokens.t: Ashkelon shall see
, and fear; Gaza also
, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.

verses.plain: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

tokens.t: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

verses.plain: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.

tokens.t: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he,
for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.

verses.plain: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.

tokens.t: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.

verses.plain: ¶ Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.

tokens.t: ¶ Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he
just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.

verses.plain: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.

tokens.t: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion
from sea
to sea, and from the river
to the ends of the earth.

verses.plain: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.

tokens.t: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein
no water.

verses.plain: ¶ Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;

tokens.t: ¶ Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare
I will render double unto thee;

verses.plain: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.

tokens.t: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.

verses.plain: And the LORD shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the Lord GOD shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.

tokens.t: And the
shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the Lord
shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.

verses.plain: The LORD of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.

tokens.t: The
of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink,
make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls,
as the corners of the altar.

verses.plain: And the LORD their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.

tokens.t: And the
their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they
the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.

verses.plain: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.

tokens.t: For how great
his goodness, and how great
his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.

footnotes.text: by…: or, whose covenant is by blood
with…: or, the stones of the sling
be…: or, fill both the bowls, etc
